alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Campbell; Charlotte (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 9:28PM EDT until July 03 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Appomattox and Campbell. In south central Virginia, Charlotte. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bear Branch, Butterwood Creek, Buttom Creek, Caldwells Creek, Appomattox River, Bear Creek, Beaverpond Branch, Carters Creek, Cemetery Creek and Bowler Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Appomattox... Concord... Rustburg... Pamplin City... Spout Spring... Evergreen... Appomattox National Historic Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
